intro: Struthanthus sessiliflorus, commonly known as the desert four o'clock, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that open in the late afternoon. The plant has hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which help it conserve water in arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Struthanthus sessiliflorus is adapted to thrive in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub habitats.
